intro: Veronica euphrasiifolia, commonly known as the sweet William or lesser veronica, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its early spring blooming period and ability to attract pollinators.
